General helper functions for the rest of the package.

class markov_helpers.utilities.ExtendedRange(*args, **kwds)¶

Combination of range and itertools.count

Any parameter can be given as None and the default will be used. stop can also be +/-inf.

Parameters
startint or None, optional, default=0

initial counter value (inclusive).

stopint or None, optional, default=inf*sign(step)

value of counter at or above which the loop terminates (exclusive).

stepint or None, optional, default=1

increment of counter after each loop.

Methods

count(value)

return number of occurences of value

index(value)

return index of value.
index(value: Union[numbers.Integral, numbers.Real]) → Union[numbers.Integral, numbers.Real]¶

return index of value. Raise ValueError if the value is not present.

start: numbers.Integral¶
step: numbers.Integral¶
stop: Union[numbers.Integral, numbers.Real]¶

class markov_helpers.utilities.RangeIsh¶

ABC for range-ish objects - those with start, stop, step attributes.

Intended for instance/subclass checks only.

Attributes
start

Start of range

step

Step between members of range

stop

End of range

abstract property start: Optional[Union[numbers.Integral, numbers.Real]]¶

abstract property step: Optional[Union[numbers.Integral, numbers.Real]]¶

abstract property stop: Optional[Union[numbers.Integral, numbers.Real]]¶

End of range

class markov_helpers.utilities.ZipSequences(*sequences: Sequence, usemax: bool = False)¶

Like zip, but sized, subscriptable and reversible (if arguments are).

Parameters
sequence1, sequence2, …

sequences to iterate over

usemaxbool, keyword only, default=False

If True, we continue until all sequences are exhausted. If False, we stop when we reach the end of the shortest sequence.

Raises
TypeError

When calling len if any memeber is is not Sized. When calling reverse if any memeber is is not Reversible. When subscripting if any memeber is is not subscriptable.

Notes

If sequences are not of equal length, the reversed iterator will not yield the same tuples as the original iterator. Each sequence is reversed as is, without omitting end-values or adding fill-values. Similar considerations apply to negative indices.

Indexing with an integer returns a (tuple of) sequence content(s). Indexing with a slice returns a (tuple of) sub-sequence(s).

Methods

count(value)

index(value, [start, [stop]])

Raises ValueError if the value is not present.
markov_helpers.utilities.default(optional: Optional[markov_helpers.utilities.Some], default_value: markov_helpers.utilities.Some) → markov_helpers.utilities.Some¶

Replace optional with default value if it is None

Parameters
optionalSome or None

The optional argument, where None indicates that the default value should be used instead.

default_valueSome

Default value for the argument, used when optional is None.

Returns
use_valueSome

Either optional, if it is not None or default_value if it is.

markov_helpers.utilities.default_eval(optional: Optional[markov_helpers.utilities.Some], default_fn: Callable[[], markov_helpers.utilities.Some], *args, **kwds) → markov_helpers.utilities.Some¶

Replace optional with evaluation of default function if it is None

Parameters
optionalSome or None

The optional argument, where None indicates that the default value should be used instead.

default_fnCallable[()->Some]

Evaluates to default value for the argument, only evaluated and used when optional is None. Does not take any arguments.

Returns
use_valueSome

Either optional, if it is not None or default_fn() if it is.

default_valueOther

Default value for the argument, used when optional is None.

Returns
use_valueOther

markov_helpers.utilities.repeatify(arg: Iterable[markov_helpers.utilities.Some], times: Optional[int] = None, exclude: Tuple[Type[Iterable], ...] = ()) → Iterable[markov_helpers.utilities.Some]¶
markov_helpers.utilities.repeatify(arg: markov_helpers.utilities.Some, times: Optional[int] = None, exclude: Tuple[Type[Iterable], ...] = ()) → Iterable[markov_helpers.utilities.Some]

Repeat argument if not iterable

Parameters
argVar or Iterable[Var]

Argument to repeat

timesint, optional

Maximum number of times to repeat, by default None.

excludeTuple[Type, …], optional

Additional iterable types to exclude from conversion, by default ().

Returns
repeatedIterable[Var]

Iterable version of arg.

markov_helpers.utilities.rev_seq(seq: Reversible) → Reversible¶

reverse a sequence, leaving it a sequence if possible

Parameters
seq_ty.Reversible

Either a sequence or a reversible iterator

Returns
rseq_ty.Reversible

If seq is a sequence, this is the sequence in reversed order, otherwise it is a reversed iterator over seq.

markov_helpers.utilities.seq_get(seq: Sequence[markov_helpers.utilities.Other], ind: Union[int, slice], default_val: Optional[markov_helpers.utilities.Other] = None) → markov_helpers.utilities.Other¶

Get an element from a sequence, or default if index is out of range

Parameters
seqSequence[Val]

The sequence from which we get the element.

indint or slice

The index of the element we want from seq.

defaultOptional[Val], optional

Value to return if ind is out of range for seq, by default None.

Returns
elementVal

Element of the sequence, seq[ind], or default.

markov_helpers.utilities.tuplify(arg: Iterable[markov_helpers.utilities.Some], num: int = 1, exclude: Tuple[Type[Iterable], ...] = ()) → Tuple[markov_helpers.utilities.Some, ...]¶
markov_helpers.utilities.tuplify(arg: markov_helpers.utilities.Some, num: int = 1, exclude: Tuple[Type[Iterable], ...] = ()) → Tuple[markov_helpers.utilities.Some, ...]

Make argument a tuple.

If it is an iterable (except str, dict), it is converted to a tuple. Otherwise, it is placed in a tuple.

Parameters
argVar|Iterable[Var]

Thing to be turned / put into a tuple.

numint, optional

Number of times to put arg in tuple, default: 1. Not used for conversion of iterables.

excludeTuple[Type, …], optional

Additional iterable types to exclude from conversion, by default ().

Returns
tuplifiedTuple[Var, …]

Tuple containing arg.

markov_helpers.utilities.unseqify(arg: Sequence[markov_helpers.utilities.Some]) → Optional[Union[markov_helpers.utilities.Some, Sequence[markov_helpers.utilities.Some]]]¶

Unpack sequence before returning, if not longer than 1.

If a sequence has a single element, return that. If empty, return None. Otherwise return the sequence.

Parameters
argSequence[Var]

Sequence to be unpacked.

Returns
valSequence[Var] or Var or None

The sequence or its contents (if there are not more than one).
